data.title: Mac Vscode doesn't start anmyore
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 insider from today (not sure which commit hash)
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra

Just upgraded vscode to the latest insider build and now it crashes on startup before even showing a window. I know that this is really vague but I don't know how to capture stack traces or more debug infos for native apps (web dev here). When launching from the terminal, vscode immediately exits silently.

A reinstall of the insiders build didn't help.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vscode-insiders
2. crash

data.title: Error not showing up when node2 is not supported
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: insiders
- OS Version: win10
- node: 7.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a simple javascript file, run vscode out of source and just add the node debug extensions
2. Node debug extension auto picks node2 however node2 does not seem to be bundled

data.title: Can't startup extensionHost
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1(stable) / 1.10.0(insiders)
- OS Version: macOs Sierra(Version 10.12.3 (16D32))
- Node.js Version: 6.9.1

I generate my javascript extension project with this guide: [yocode](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/tools/yocode).

After installation, I press `F5` to open Extension Development Host, and it turns out `Extension host did not start in 10 seconds, it might be stopped on the first line and needs a debugger to continue.`.
Of course the `Hello World` command can't work.

I've also tried Node.js 7.5.0/4.2.2, and all with no luck.

data.title: Uplevel node-pty@0.6.2
Apply search.exclude patterns to workspace symbol search as well
data.body:
There is a feature request to exclude certain folders from workspace symbol search in the Go extension.

Creating this issue here to discuss if it makes sense to use the `search.exclude` setting (or a new setting similar to it) and apply the same to workspace symbol search feature in the core product, so that individual extensions do not need to implement it.

Or one can argue that performance wise, it would be better if individual extensions do this exclusion rather than the core product filtering out given pattern.

cc @Microsoft/vscode

data.title: Code view scrolls when code lens is dismissed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable a code lens
2. Scroll down to a position where there is a code lens above the rendered lines
3. Disable the code lens

Result:
The code scrolls up a couple lines.

Expected:
Center line should stay centered.

I'm not sure this ever happens in VSCode proper, but embedding it on sourcegraph.com exhibits the issue. If you go here: https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/gorilla/mux/-/blob/mux.go#L52:74 and click the Show authors button a couple times it exhibited the issue before b86e32169ef2523826486cb7cf915d9cf9117cf1 was applied. That patch might be a starting point, but it probably needs additional checks.

data.title: Possible Bug: Single-Stepping in JS involving 'Get' Property Accessor
data.body:
![singlestepfail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22031088/22912146/8114b69e-f29e-11e6-8e26-e85cb66c4718.png)

The screen capture shows a simple JS app. When single-stepping, the debugger caused property 'z' to be modified. The expected output should be '1', '2', '3', and 'bye'. However, when single-stepping in VSCode, the outputs (i.e, values of 'z') depend on how frequent you view/inspect the object 'o1' in the Variable window.

data.title: Add Status Bar Item for JSConfig/TSConfig
data.body:
Fixes #20356

Adds a status bar item that shows which jsconfig/tsconfig a ts or js file currently belongs to. This triggers the `typescript.goToProjectConfig` command when clicked, which either jumps to the config file or shows an alert about creating a configuration file.

Here's what the new bar looks like:

![screen shot 2017-02-13 at 5 00 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/22910313/fb3cb016-f20d-11e6-9feb-72d441d77cef.png)
![screen shot 2017-02-13 at 5 00 36 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/22910314/fb546706-f20d-11e6-9e3a-f66c4dbc20fb.png)

Let me know if you have suggestions for the wording or appearance of the status bar item.

data.body:
Getting `Marketplace returned 'ECONNREFUSED'. Please check the 'http.proxy' setting.` after most recent insiders update.  Worked on Friday when I last opened it.  Didn't change any settings.  Not using a proxy.  I'm assuming latest update broke it somehow since it started happening right after I updated this morning.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider 422d7ff1b78fcac514498921551c33a988c4ad34 2017-02-13T07:02:30.785Z
- OS Version: OSX 10.10.5 (14F2109)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download above vscode-insiders build
2. Restart vscode
3. Open extensions
4. See "Marketplace returned 'ECONNREFUSED'. Please check the 'http.proxy' setting."

Need any more info?

data.title: update method of WorkspaceConfiguration not working as expected
Drag and drop selection in editor
data.body:
Fix #1046. 

Click and hold the left mouse key on a selection now can be monitored but the implementation of moving the selection is not good. I'm creating a secondary cursor to show where the text will be pasted to however it ruins our undo/redo stack as the secondary cursor is a real cursor.

The ideal experience would be similar to Hover. Draw the virtual cursor by decoration and draw a popup window with the text being moved.

TODO:
- [x]  Refactor the code by putting the logic into a widget

Verify:
- [x] Single click on a selection
- [x] Single click besides a selection
- [x] Click, hold and move should still do selection. Verify both upwards and downwards.
- [x] Undo/Redo still works reasonably.

data.title: Update Perl6 syntax highlighting to allow for kebab-case in addition to snake_case
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a file called `test.pl6` or `test.pm6`
2. Type the following in:

```
sub print-board() # Wrong

sub thing-for-that() # Wrong
```

3. See that the words `print` and `for` are highlighted as if they are keywords.

4. Change it to snake case and notice that it is like a normal variable again:

```
sub print_board() # Correct

sub thing_for_that() # Correct
```

Solution:

Update [this file](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/perl/syntaxes/Perl%206.tmLanguage) with the kebab case addition.

data.title: Consider supporting files with .msil extension
VSCode debug controls positioned out of editor
data.body:
I accidentally positioned the debug controls outside the editor's bounds.Now every time I open that project, it comes like that.

![Debug controls beyond the left bounds](https://i.stack.imgur.com/AOpFt.png)
I [found the fix](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42199245/vscode-debug-controls-positioned-out-of-editor) by deleting the "Application Support" data

- VSCode Version:1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to debug mode in any program
2. Hold the handle on the left side of the debug controls and move your mouse all the way beyond the left bounds of the editor until it clips off.

data.title: Where did window.showFullPath go?
data.body: Doesn't seem to be available anymore, Is there a replacement for it?

data.title: A call for more extension categories
data.body:
Taking a look at the current state of extension categories:

![screen shot 2017-02-13 at 10 39 01 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/87356/22895161/c9cb32f8-f1d8-11e6-8645-38cd3ce4aad9.png)

Other: 1087 extensions!

This is a pretty clear sign that some more categories are needed in the extension marketplace. Has this been brought up at all? How would the team and/or community go about deciding on what an appropriate list of categories would be and how difficult is it for the team to add these into the marketplace?
